meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to believe something that is not true.
meanings.sent1: She tried to deceive her friend by telling a fake story.
meanings.sent2: The magician used his tricks to deceive the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to deceive the dog by hiding behind the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The mirage in the desert can deceive travelers into thinking they see water.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's charming smile was used to deceive unsuspecting victims.

meanings.definition: Fail to admit to oneself that something is true.
meanings.sent1: He would deceive himself into thinking he was not scared of the dark.
meanings.sent2: She would deceive herself into believing she didn't need help.
meanings.sent3: The student would deceive himself into thinking he didn't need to study for the test.
meanings.sent4: The driver would deceive himself into believing he didn't need to check the gas gauge.
meanings.sent5: The patient would deceive himself into thinking he didn't need to take his medication.
